text: An Address, to the Hon. Edmund Burke. from the Swinish Multitude was a widely reviewed pamphlet by James Parkinson published in 1793 under his pseudonym "Old Hubert" in response and criticism to Edmund Burke's use of the phrase "swinish multitude" in his 1790 book Reflections on the Revolution in France. E. P. Thompson quotes Parkinson's following passage from the pamphlet, in his The Making of the English Working Class: == References == == External links == * An Address, to the Hon. Edmund Burke from the Swinish Multitude on Google Books Category:Pamphlets Category:Edmund Burke Category:1793
title: An Address, to the Hon. Edmund Burke from the Swinish Multitude
